alert.note: Alert for Northwestern Fremont County Above 8500Ft; Western, Central Fremont County Below 8500 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 23 at 10:50PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Fremont County through 1115 PM MDT... At 1048 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of Texas Creek, moving southeast at less than 5 mph. Torrential rain is occuring with this storm, with the heaviest rain currently falling between Parkdale and Texas Creek. Localized Flash Flooding and rock slides are possible near Highway 50. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Fremont County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Northwestern Fremont County Above 8500Ft; Western, Central Fremont County Below 8500 Ft
